info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 1:13AM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MARIPOSA...CENTRAL TUOLUMNE AND NORTH CENTRAL MADERA COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM PDT... At 112 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Yosemite Valley, or 16 miles north of Yosemite South Entrance, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Yosemite National, Yosemite Valley, Sunrise High Sierra Camp, Tuolumne Meadows, Merced Lake Ranger Station, Morraine Dome Campground, Camp 4 Campground, Snow Flat, Ostrander Lake, Dana Meadows, Little Yosemite Valley Ranger Station, Yosemite Valley Vistor Center, Tuolumne Meadows Visitor Center, Upper Pines Campground, Tioga Pass, Merced Lake High Sierra Camp, Little Yosemite Valley Campground, Porcupine Flat Campground, Badger Pass Ranger Station, and White Wolf Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
